intro: Benthamia hongkongensis, commonly known as Hong Kong benthamia, is a flowering plant native to Hong Kong and southern China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. It has a short stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
